articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Elders' Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Elders' Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the elders' delegation headed by Jimmy Carter, ex-president of the U.S., at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Elders' Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Elders' Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting elders' delegation.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by head of the delegation Jimmy Carter, ex-president of the U.S., on Wednesday.

articles.title: Elders' Delegation Tours Different Places
articles.content:
Elders' Delegation Tours Different Places 
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The elders' delegation headed by Jimmy Carter, ex-president of the U.S., visited Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies on Wednesday.
					 The guests were briefed on the successes made by the University in the educational work, provided with modern educational equipment, and exchanged conversations with students in a lecture room.
					
					 They also visited a nurses' school in South Phyongan Province, the Phyongsong City People's Hospital, etc. They enjoyed a grand magic being staged at May Day Stadium.
					
					  Meanwhile, the elders' delegation gave a reception on Wednesday in connection with the visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift from Head of Russian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Head of Russian Delegation
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the head of the visiting Russian fishery delegation.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Andrei Kraini, head of the Federal Agency of Fisheries of Russia, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Mongolian Party Leader on Cooperative Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Mongolian Party Leader on Cooperative Relations with DPRK 
Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The relations between the DPRK and Mongolia will further develop, said U. Khurelsukh, general secretary of the Mongolian People's Party, who visited the DPRK.
					He went on:
					
					The relations between the two countries have steadily developed.
					
					The history of developing the relations between Mongolia and the DPRK is associated with the efforts exerted by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The feats performed by the President for the development of the friendly relations between the two countries are great, indeed.
					
					The President visited Mongolia several times, providing the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					The DPRK government rendered sincere assistance to Mongolia when it was hit hard by natural disasters.
					
					We express sincere thanks to the party and government of the DPRK for this.
					
					The friendly relations between the two countries have favorably developed as the days go by under the deep concern of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					In the past period, an agreement on boosting the cooperation in various fields was reached between the two governments. 
					
					We will make positive efforts to boost the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries.

articles.title: Ports in Rason City to Be Updated
articles.content:
Ports in Rason City to Be Updated
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Rason City in the northern part of the DPRK has natural and geographical conditions favorable for marine transport.
					There are Rajin, Sonbong and Ungsang Ports in the city.
					
					 Rajin Port is surrounded by the Rajin peninsula and Socho and Taecho Islets to ensure security of vessels. The water of the port is deep and unfrozen in winter.
					
					 The port deals with various kinds of cargo, including equipment, processed fish and foodstuffs.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam, vice-director of the Economic Cooperation Department of the Rason City People's Committee, told KCNA that the Rajin, Sonbong and Ungsang Ports would be updated to sharply increase the cargo traffic.

articles.title: Presentation of Grand Magic Goes on
articles.content:
Presentation of Grand Magic Goes on
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The performance of grand magic is going on at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang.
					 Its repertoire included "Motorcyclist's Escape from Globe and Disappearance of Large Bus", "Flying Man", "Change of Persons in Air and Appearance of Elephant, Horse and Bear" and "Appearance of Helicopter on Stage and Magician's Escape from Dropping Box".
					
					 Conspicuous were stage decor, varieties of electronic devices and lighting effect.
					
					 The performance mesmerized the spectators for its unique artistic style and contents and acrobats' refined skills and admirable representation.
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: Foodstuff Production Goes Up
articles.content:
Foodstuff Production Goes Up
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Combined foodstuff factories in all provinces are keeping production going on a high level.
					 Some of them have newly built millet jelly production processes and directed much effort to putting the foodstuff production on a scientific and standardized basis, while lowering the amount of raw material consumed per unit of product.
					
					 The Paeksong and Songdowon Combined Foodstuff Factories have increased the output of cookies and other foodstuffs through the already built millet jelly production processes.
					
					 The Suyangsan and Paekunsan Combined Foodstuff Factories have boosted the production based on locally-available raw materials such as seaweed and edible herbs.
					
					 Those in North Hwanghae and Jagang Provinces have streamlined cookie packing and corn processing processes.
					
					Some time ago, General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to the Susongchon Combined Foodstuff Factory and called for increasing the output and diversifying the products with raw materials abundant in the area.

articles.title: Celebrated Medical Scientist
articles.content:
Celebrated Medical Scientist 
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jin Su, teaching at Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, is a scientist well known at home and abroad.
					 He, 86, has made a great contribution to the development of the nation's medical science and education over the past six decades.
					
					 He invented more than 100 operation and treatment methods and conducted operations on many patients.
					
					 His stomach operation method is considered an advanced therapy.
					
					 He also made a good job of esophageal cancer operation and exudative pleurisy treatment.
					
					 He wrote hundreds of textbooks, reference books and papers and produced tens of awardees of academic degrees or titles.
					
					 He is a winner of the Kim Il Sung Prize and a member of the Academy of Sciences.

articles.title: Charcoal Used in Korea from Ancient Times
articles.content:
Charcoal Used in Korea from Ancient Times
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Korean people began to use charcoal in ancient times.
					 Using wood as fuel, they found that charcoal made by burning wood gave off less smoke and generated higher heat.
					
					 To make charcoal for metal smelting, oak and pine trees were used.
					
					When ironing clothes and heating rooms, charcoals from paulownia and ash trees were chosen.
					
					 Charcoal from willow and camellia trees were suitable for polish.
					
					 Charcoal was also applied to preparing food. In particular, some pieces of charcoal were put in jars for making soybean sauce and kimchi.

articles.title: Time-honored Dressing Custom of Korean People
articles.content:
Time-honored Dressing Custom of Korean People
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Korean costume has a long history of development.
					On display at the Korean Folklore Museum are a bone-needle and spinning wheel dating back to some 8 000 years ago and clay button and weft pirn to some 5,000 years ago, an evidence that the Koreans wove cloth for dresses already in the primitive ages.
					
					 The national dressing custom was mainly formed in the ancient times. At that time, Koreans made hemp cloth, woolen fabric and silk.
					
					 In the period of Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668), they wore different silk dresses according to sex, occupation and social stratum.
					
					 Korean costume became more diverse in shape, pattern and color in the Ri Dynasty.
					
					 Now seen in streets of the country are women in chima (skirt) and jogori (coat) with spring fairly setting in.

articles.title: Famous Lady Painter of Ri Dynasty
articles.content:
Famous Lady Painter of Ri Dynasty
Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Sinsa Im Dang was a famous painter of the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					 She was gifted with talent in poetry, calligraphy and painting.
					
					 In particular, she was very fond of painting.
					
					 Her masterpieces are "Mandarin Fish", "Grapes", "Eggplant", "Wild Geese", "Autumn Grass" and "Swans in Lotus Pond".
					
					 "Autumn Grass" was favored even by the royal family. It was used as a model of ceramic pattern.
					
					 "Eggplant" evinces her brush characterized by lifelike representation.
					
					She also made many albums, folding screens and scrolls.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun: GNP-led Ruling Forces of S. Korea Hotbed of All Social Evils
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun: GNP-led Ruling Forces of S. Korea Hotbed of All Social Evils
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article terms the "Grand National Party"-led ruling forces of south Korea corrupt group which has accumulated enormous wealth by fraud and swindle and a hotbed of all social evils.
					This is clearly evidenced by the recent results of announcement of the property of high-ranking officials in south Korea, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It was brought to light that this year most of them abused their authority, amassing more fortune than that last year by raking in huge profits through the raised real estate prices and their involvement in stock dealings.
					
					 What matters is that such huge properties in the hands of the conservative forces are nothing but the money earned by the toiling masses at the cost of their blood and sweat and this was expropriated by those forces by various illicit means such as fraud and swindle and tax evasion.
					
					 Hideous irregularities and corruption are reported in south Korea almost every day. These lay bare the hypocritical nature of the GNP-led conservative ruling forces which never miss a change without talking about the "improvement of people's living," "integrity", "combating irregularities and corruption" and "clean politics."
					
					 The past three years of the south Korean conservative forces in power are crowded with the cases of irregularities and corruption in which they have only sought their avaricious interests by bleeding the people white, while enforcing policies for the rich and the tycoons. 
					
					 South Korea has turned into a terrible scene of utter confusion entirely because of the corruption and unpopular rule of the above-said conservative ruling forces. 
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that people of various circles in south Korea are deploring that "the power-backed irregularities and corruption" of the ruling quarters have become rampant" since the emergence of the present "government."
					
					 The public is the best judge. The above-said corrupt group forsaken by the people is bound to be thrown into the dumping ground of history.

articles.title: DPRK-targeted War Maneuvers Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
DPRK-targeted War Maneuvers Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The 5th tactical airlifting flying corps of the south Korean puppet air force kicked off a combined field exercise aimed at intruding into the DPRK in the area of Uiryong County, South Kyongsang Province on Monday, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Involved in the military exercise which will last till April 29 are special units mainly tasked to carry out their duties in the areas of the DPRK, C-130, CN-235, HH-47 and other war hardware.
					
					 From the first day of the exercise the warmongers got busy with the drills for letting agents of special units parachute on mountainous areas simulating areas of the DPRK and airlifting supplies.
					
					 After their parachuting, agents of the special units are busy with choosing the sites for planes' landing at night and conducting reconnaissance, watch and ambush operations.
					
					 In another development, they are planning to stage provocative combined anti-terror exercise, etc. in Haeundae District of Pusan and Kijang County from April 26 and 28.  
					
					 They are mulling hurling three services of the puppet forces, civilians, administrative officials and police forces into DPRK-targeted war exercises under the signboard of "combating terrorism" by someone.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Undying Feats Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Undying Feats Praised by British Organization
						
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet homepage an article on April 16 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Not only the Korean people but the world progressives boundlessly revere the President as the sun of mankind, the article said, and went on:
					
					  Kim Il Sung was the father of the Korean nation and the founder of socialist Korea.
					
					 He made a new history in which the Korean people are hewing out their destiny independently and performed the undying feats which will shine long with the era of independence.
					
					 The Korean people adorned the 20th century with victory and glory under his wise leadership.
					
					 He was the iron-willed commander and gifted strategist who led the two hard-fought revolutionary wars to victory.
					
					 He carried out the complicated social revolution of two phases and built an independent and advanced socialist system centering on the popular masses in Korea.
					
					 He authored more than 10,800 works all his life.
					
					 His works have been published and disseminated in many countries.
					
					 It is the duty of the world progressives to remain true to his idea and embody it and defend Juche Korea, the socialist bulwark, the article stressed.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Il Sung Commemorated 
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- TV and radios of different countries aired commemorative programs and showed Korean films on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					The Syria TV Channel on April 15 telecast scenes showing the President working together with General Secretary Kim Jong Il and introduced the glorious revolutionary history of the President and the Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Introducing the development of the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Syria, the television aired some scenes of the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".
					
					 The radio broadcasting service of Syria aired the similar program on the same day.
					
					 The TV Broadcasting Service of Finland on April 15 showed a photo of Kim Il Sung, giving detailed accounts of events held in the DPRK including the 13th Kimilsungia Festival.
					
					 The TV Broadcasting Service of Equatorial Guinea on April 14 and 15 repeatedly aired a program telling the stories that Kim Il Sung led a protected armed struggle to liberate Korea, founded the DPRK and turned it into a strong socialist bulwark.
					
					 The F.M. 90.5 Radio of Cambodia on April 15 in a program praised Kim Il Sung for founding the Juche idea and working heart and soul for the prosperity of the country, the happiness of its people and the global independence all his life.
					
					 On the same day the C. Equis 36 Radio Centenario of Uruguay introduced in detail Mangyongdae and members of the revolutionary family of the President.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Commemorated Abroad 
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung was held in Italy and book, photo and handicraft exhibitions in Mexico and Malaysia on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung between April 13 and 20.
					Displayed in the venues of the events were works of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on their undying exploits, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts showing skills of Koreans.
					
					 The secretary general of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche idea said that the Songun idea founded by the President is an idea calling for dynamically pushing ahead with the overall revolutionary movement, giving priority to the military affairs and putting forward the revolutionary army as a main force.
					
					 He said that socialism in the DPRK is making a long drive thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il and the validity and vitality of the Songun politics are being more strikingly demonstrated with each passing day.
					
					 The president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy said the Korean people are making a dynamic advance under the uplifted banner of socialism under hard conditions because they have thoroughly embodied the Juche idea in all fields.
					
					 The president of Ecatepec University of Technology of Mexico said that the Korean people have brought about world-startling miracles and innovations under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung, adding that such successes and a wealth of experience serve as a precious treasure for progressive mankind.

articles.title: April Holidays of DPRK Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
April Holidays of DPRK Marked in Various Countries
Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Events were held in various countries between April 11 and 18 on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army. They included seminars and book and photo exhibitions in Tajikistan and Italy, a meeting in Poland and film shows in Norway and the Czech Republic.
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos on their undying exploits and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 The secretary of the Sogd Regional Committee of the Communist Party of Tajikistan highly praised Kim Il Sung for founding the original Juche idea, the Songun idea and successfully embodying them in practice, thereby turning the DPRK into an invincible socialist power.
					
					 The undying exploits performed by the President have been successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il, he said, referring to the fact that Kim Jong Il has firmly defended the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the nation under the uplifted banner of Songun and powerfully aroused the army and people of the DPRK to a dynamic drive for building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 The secretary for youth of the Communist Reconstruction Party of Italy noted that Kim Il Sung was a political elder who made a great contribution to global independence. Progressive mankind always remember the President who ushered in a new era of the national liberation struggle in colonies and are learning from Korean-style socialism, he added.
					
					 The chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway said that the undying feats performed by the President for the Korean and world revolution would always be remembered not only by the Korean people but also by progressive mankind.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Vietnamese Paper
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Vietnamese Paper
						
Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Vietnamese paper Cuu Chien Binh on April 18 carried photos of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities and an article titled "Workers' Party of Korea leading the building of a thriving nation."
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK declared before the world more than ten years ago that it would launch a drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 This was a very astonishing event under the situation at that time. This was because the Korean people were undergoing unprecedented ordeals and difficulties due to the natural disasters for consecutive years and the harsh sanctions and blockade of the allied imperialist forces from the middle of the 1990s.
					
					 The modern history of the DPRK records that time as the period of the Arduous March, the forced march.
					
					 But the Korean people pulled through difficulties, rallied close around the WPK which held high the banner of Songun.
					
					 The WPK has consistently maintained the line of economic construction in the era of Songun which provides a sure guarantee for the building of an economic power despite the moves of the imperialists. It has also pushed forward the development of the overall national economy, regarding the metal, power and coal industries and railways transport as the pilot domains of the national economy.
					
					 The WPK considered the policy of attaching importance to idea, the policy of attaching importance to army and that of attaching importance to science and technology as the three main pillars for building a thriving nation and made the drive for pushing back the frontiers of latest science and technology rage across the country.

articles.title: PLO Rejects US Call
articles.content:
PLO Rejects US Call
						
Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Saeb Erekat, a member in Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), bitterly rejected the U.S. call at an interview with a newspaper on April 22.
					 He said that if United States intends to call for renewing the peace talks, it must hold Israeli premier Benjamin Netanyahu responsible for the talks' failure.
					
					 U.S. officials must also commit Netanyahu to halting settlement and accepting an international reference, he noted.

articles.title: More US Soldiers Killed in Iraqa
articles.content:
More US Soldiers Killed in Iraq
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- An increasing number of U.S. troops present in Iraq are being killed by the military operations of its resistance forces. 
					 Two U.S. service members were killed Friday in southern Iraq.
					
					 The death toll of U.S. soldiers who have been killed in Iraq since the war broke out in 2003 rose to about 4,450.

articles.title: Americans Displeased with Deteriorating Living
articles.content:
Americans Displeased with Deteriorating Living
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Americans are expressing their bitter grievances about their deteriorating living due to the unreasonable policy of the authorities.
					 According to the results of a nationwide opinion poll conducted by the Washington Post and ABC, many respondents expressed concern over the evermore serious joblessness. 
					
					 About 70 percent of the respondents deplored that their living further deteriorated due to the oil price rise.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Solomon Islands
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Solomon Islands
 Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- A magnitude 6.9 earthquake jolted Solomon Islands on April 23.
					 Its epicenter was 171 km away southeast from Honiara.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reúne con la delegación de Elders
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reúne con la delegación de Elders
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, departió el día 27 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegación de Elders encabezada por Jimmy Carter, ex presidente de EE.UU., que le hizo una visita de cortesía.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de la delegación de Elders
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de la delegación de Elders
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibió presente que le dedicara la delegación de Elders, de visita en Corea.
					  El jefe de la delegación, Jimmy Carter, ex presidente norteamericano, lo entregó el día 27 al presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Kim Yong Nam.

articles.title: Delegación de Elders visita varios lugares
articles.content:
Delegación de Elders visita varios lugares 
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- La delegación de Elders presidida por el ex presidente estadounidense Jimmy Carter visitó la Universidad de Lenguas Extranjeras de Pyongyang.
					  Los huéspedes escucharon las explicaciones sobre los equipos docentes y los éxitos logrados por el plantel y conversaron con los alumnos en un aula.
					
					  La delegación visitó también la Escuela de Enfermería, el Hospital del Pueblo de la Ciudad de Phyonsong y otros lugares de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur y disfrutó la gran función de magia que tiene lugar en el capitalino Estadio Primero de Mayo.
					
					  Además, ofreció el día 27 un banquete con motivo de su visita a Corea.

articles.title: Se proyecta la modernización de los puertos en Rason
articles.content:
Se proyecta la modernización de los puertos en Rason
						
Pyongyang, 27 de abril (ATCC) -- La ciudad de Rason de Corea tiene buenas condiciones naturales y geográficas para el desarrollo de transporte marítimo.
					La ciudad cuenta con los puertos de Rajin, Sonbong y Ungsang.
					
					El primer puerto está rodeado por la península de Rajin y los islotes Socho y Taecho, lo cual garantiza la seguridad de los barcos.
					
					Es considerado como puerto ideal porque se halla en un mar profundo que no se congela en el invierno.
					
					Actualmente, el puerto opera las cargas de diferentes tipos como equipos, pescados elaborados y alimentos.
					
					El subjefe del departamento de cooperación económica del Comité Popular de la Ciudad de Rason, Kim Yong Nam (de 44 años de edad), comentó a la ATCC el plan de modernizar dichos puertos para incrementar mucho más que ahora la capacidad de tránsito de cargas.
